Summary A versatile networking engineer with 10 years sales and technical experience. With a special passion for helping customers and partners cross the chasm in to new technology areas to enable better ways of working and business transformation. 
 
Matt has helped introduce new technologies to the UK market through consultancy, building lab facilities, designing training and offering bespoke sessions to customers, partners and colleagues. Key focus areas include secure access, BYOD and converged wired/wireless networking. 
 
Matt has strong team building and teamwork skills, combined with extensive presentation experience to both CXO and technical audiences. His current role is working across the UK & Ireland Enterprise accounts to help drive change and explore new technology areas. 
 
New technology excites me - any role offering something new and interesting (especially disruptive) will be of strong interest. Experience Consulting Systems Engineer Cisco August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Specialist pre-sales architecture Systems Engineer covering next generation Data Centres and Network Programmability. Focussed on UK Public Sector and Enterprise customers. 
 
Key skills and responsibilities: 
• Customer opportunity support – work with key UK organisations on large, complex or 'pre-chasm' opportunities, especially around future data centres, programmability and orchestration. 
• Position the full Cisco data centre stack, management portfolio and ACI vision 
• Customer, partner, colleague training - provide in-depth training and education on new technology and trends, including overall architecture and hands-on labs 
• Solutions Expertise – Building high quality customer-driven solutions with repeatable architectures and designs 
• Vertical/Technical specialist – work with the wider business as an advisor to the UK&Is specific needs and feed back customer requirements that have tangible impact to our future strategy 
• CXO presentation skills, presenting frequently in Cisco’s customer Executive Briefing Centre (EBC). 
• Demo Design and Implementation – worked to build leading-edge customer demonstration facilities around bring your own device, energy management and other key enterprise networking offerings. Consulting Systems Engineer Cisco November 2013  –  August 2014  (10 months) Specialist pre-sales resource covering the Enterprise Networking portfolio (switching, wireless and routing) with customers in the enterprise segment (retail, finance, professional services, manufacturing). 
 
Key skills and responsibilities: 
• Customer opportunity support – work with key UK enterprise customers on large, complex or 'pre-chasm' opportunities. Engage on early field trials, reference opportunities and key deals. 
• Switching virtual team – Built UK&I switching team of expertise to compete more effectively, engage better with business units and have a full range of business/technical expertise at every level of our sales cycle 
• Customer, partner, colleague training - provide in-depth training and education on new technology and trends, including overall architecture and hands-on labs 
• Solutions Expertise – Building high quality customer-driven solutions and educating colleagues, customers and partners. Driving customer change through technology and expertise. 
• Vertical/Technical specialist – work with the wider business as an advisor to the UK&Is specific needs and feed back customer requirements that have tangible impact to our future strategy 
• CXO presentation skills, presenting frequently in Cisco’s customer Executive Briefing Centre (EBC). 
• Programme Management – organised the Cisco Live labs programme in London for five years, working with colleagues around the world 
• Demo Design and Implementation – worked to build leading-edge customer demonstration facilities around bring your own device, energy management and other key enterprise networking offerings. Focussed on UK Enterprise, with specific expertise in enterprise switching and mobility.

Borderless Systems Engineer Cisco August 2011  –  July 2012  (1 year) A Cisco Systems Engineer focussed transformational customer solutions, borderless architecture, routing and switching and competitive wins. 
 
Key skills and responsibilities: 
•	Routing and Switching Teams – Built UK&I switching and routing teams of expertise to compete more effectively, engage better with business units and have a full range of business/technical expertise at every level of our sales cycle 
•	Transformative business consulting – Working as part of the Cisco Transformative Networking programme, Matt is a key Technical Solutions Architect for key Cisco accounts to help drive next generation business solutions and technical engagement 
•	Key deal support – provide support on very high priority UK&I deals to provide the highest value solution that is competitive, profitable and technically sound 
•	Vertical/Technical specialist – work with the wider business as an advisor to the UK&Is specific needs and feed back customer requirements that have tangible impact to our future strategy 
•	CXO presentation skills, presenting frequently in Cisco’s customer Executive Briefing Centre (EBC). 
•	UK Public Sector vertical understanding, including working as a principal architect on Cisco’s Regional PSN blueprint designs 
•	Programme Management – organised the Cisco Live labs programme in London for five years, working with colleagues around the world 
•	Demo Design and Implementation – worked to build leading-edge customer demonstration facilities around bring your own device, energy management and other key borderless offerings. Borderless Systems Engineer Cisco August 2009  –  July 2011  (2 years) A Borderless Networks SE focussed on the UK Public Sector and Routing and Switching infrastructure. Worked with large clients and multi-million dollar opportunities. Presented to CTOs, CEOs and other key business personnel, as well as running detailed technology sessions and industry presentations to large audiences. 
 
Key skills and responsibilities: 
•	Transformative business consulting – Working as part of the Cisco Transformative Networking programme, Matt is a key Technical Solutions Architect for key Cisco accounts to help drive next generation business solutions and technical engagement 
•	Network design skills – worked as the ultimate design authority for campus networks in the UK Public Sector, including high availability campus design, Borderless Networks and WAN/DC design 
•	Vertical/Technical specialist – represent Cisco in the “SEVT” (SE Virtual Team) programme as a field advisor, visiting the US business units frequently. 
•	CXO presentation skills, presenting frequently in Cisco’s customer Executive Briefing Centre (EBC). 
•	UK Public Sector vertical understanding, including working as a principal architect on Cisco’s Regional PSN blueprint designs 
•	Worked extensively across public sector including Universities, Hospitals, Defence, Local and Central Government. 
•	Programme Management – organised the Cisco Live labs programme in London for five years, working with colleagues around the world Channel Systems Engineer Cisco September 2006  –  July 2009  (2 years 11 months) Feltham Aligned to a number of key channel partners as their primary technical contact in to Cisco. 
 
Responsible for: 
1. Technical enablement, ensuring they had the best information, appropriate training and a heads-up of what's coming in the Cisco roadmap 
2. Technology seminars, such as deep-dive Catalyst switch boot camps, customer technology updates and business unit meetings 
3. Technology evangelism, promoting routing, switching and digital media systems across Cisco's channel to sales executives, technical leaders and other decision makers. 
4. Key deal support, such as lab proof of concepts, high level designs, partner assistance and major deal opportunity support 
 
In parallel to this I was an active member of the Routing and Switching SE Virtual Team, a closed global community of experts that meet twice a year in San Jose with the business units to discuss product roadmap, local markets and future strategy. Associate Systems Engineer Cisco September 2005  –  July 2006  (11 months) Amsterdam Joined Cisco through the CSAP graduate scheme. This scheme takes candidates from across Europe, Middle East and Africa and puts them through an intensive training regime. 
 
Key areas covered include: 
1. In-depth training on Cisco's portfolio, technology, go to market and structure 
2. Presentation skills training, including how to "own the room" and engage audiences 
3. Significant amount of working under pressure, frequently having to balance education and KPIs set during the scheme 
4. Cisco field engagement, including shadowing, deal ownership and gradual integration to the UK&I Field. Summary I’m a Systems Engineer Manager at Cisco Global Virtual Sales Organization with solid technical and pre-sales education and experience within IT Architectures, acting as a global consultant across internal teams, end-customers and ecosystem partners.  
 
As part of a journey to be a "transformaI people oriented leader in a global environment", today I manage a global and highly knowledgeable team of pre-sales technical consultants who focus on business outcomes and I actively collaborate to the strategic growth of the organization. 
 
Combining technical expertise with people leadership skills, I collected a record of positive results, promoting the growth of the company, the organization within the company and the people.  
 
Fascinated with intercultural and global relationships and passionate about technology as an enabler, I believe I’m in a strong position to build the next generation Systems Engineering Model for Cisco and for the IT industry. 
 
Specialties: 
- People oriented manager with focus on people talent development and coaching 
- Communication & Relationship with the IT Market (both end-customers and channel ecosystem) 
- Global worker with intercultural awareness, interacting daily with multiple regions, speaking in English, Spanish and Portuguese 
- Global task force leader, working on special assignments requested by top leaders within the company 
- Collaboration Architectures (voice, video, telepresence, contact center, messaging, mobility etc). 
- Enterprise Networking Architectures 
- Vertical Markets knowledge (Finance, Healthcare, Manufacturing, Retail, Real Estate & Construction etc) 
 
Please don't hesitate to contact me at akupfer@cisco.com.
